attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LssKcTxLd29X3QD0H7K_itemcontent
attribs.current: Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

attribs.name: character_backstory
attribs.current:
Trovato abbandonato in fasce in una palude nei dintorni di Kenthemor da una famiglia umana di commercianti itineranti da cui viene allevato e cresciuto. Insieme alla famiglia adottiva girovaga per i vari villaggi e piccole città senza avere una dimora precisa.
In particolare si ritrova a viaggare tra le re grandi città delle Terre Meridionali  Kenthemor, Calendum e Valimar

Dai viaggi con la sua famiglia adottiva impara  storie e leggi delle varie località che ne hanno incrementato la conoscenza.

Non ha alcuna conoscenza delle proprie origini  salvo un amuleto trovato insieme a lui e da cui non si separa mai. Ha incontrato raramente altri Dragonborn e non conosce molto della storia del suo popolo naturale se non quella appresa dalla strade di mercato e dai libri.
Mentre con i Dragoborn maschi riesce a intendersi a suon di pugni, in presenza di Dragoborn del sesso opposto si ritrova agitato , con le mani sudati e con un’inspiegabile mancanza di parole.

Raggiunta la maggiore età lascia la sua famiglia umana e si avventura nella città di Kenthemor delle Terre Meridionali ritrovandosi  a lavorare come cacciatore di taglie. Scopre di avere talento con arco e frecce e ne perfeziona lo stile completamente da solo arrivando a raggiungere anche una certa fama.
Rimane in contatto con la sua famiglia umana a cui invia del denaro a intervalli regolari.
Durante una missione per la battuta di caccia a un Worg che imperversava nelle campagne vicine , si ritrova separato dagli altri cacciatori e messo alle spalle al muro dal Worg con il quale intraprende una dura battaglia.
Ferito e al limite viene salvato all’ultimo istante da un misterioso Tieffling  di nome Zonturas che si accanisce sulla bestia finendola. Da allora a intrapreso diverse missioni con il Tieffling arrivando a considerarlo un compagno e amico fidato, benché abbiano opinioni contrastanti su diverse cose e non è insolito sentirli discutere su futili motivi.

Zonturas e Nolgara hanno avuto una relazione di 1 anno , finita circa 6 mesi fa e di cui Stonemoon non è a conoscenza .

attribs.name: additional_feature_and_traits
attribs.current:
Dragonborn Traits
Your Draconic heritage manifests in a variety of traits you share with other dragonborn.

Ability Score Increase: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

Age: Young dragonborn grow quickly. They walk hours after hatching, attain the size and development of a 10-year-old human child by the age of 3, and reach Adulthood by 15. They live to be around 80.

Alignment: Dragonborn tend to extremes, making a conscious choice for one side or the other in the cosmic war between good and evil. Most dragonborn are good, but those who side with evil can be terrible villains.

Size: Dragonborn are taller and heavier than humans, standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging almost 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.

Speed: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Draconic Ancestry Dragon 	Damage Type 	Breath Weapon
Black 	Acid 	5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)
Blue 	Lightning 	5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)
Brass 	Fire 	5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)
Bronze 	Lightning 	5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)
Copper 	Acid 	5 by 30 ft. line (Dex. save)
Gold 	Fire 	15 ft. cone (Dex. save)
Green 	Poison 	15 ft. cone (Con. save)
Red 	Fire 	15 ft. cone (Dex. save)
Silver 	Cold 	15 ft. cone (Con. save)
White 	Cold 	15 ft. cone (Con. save)
Draconic Ancestry: You have Draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon and damage Resistance are determined by the dragon type, as shown in the table.

Breath Weapon: You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your Draconic ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation.

When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your Draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your Proficiency Bonus. A creature takes 2d6 damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th level, and 5d6 at 16th level.

After you use your breath weapon, you can’t use it again until you complete a short or Long Rest.

Damage Resistance: You have Resistance to the damage type associated with your Draconic ancestry.

Languages: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest Languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

Attributes
Size
Medium
Speed
30

attribs.name: allies_and_organizations
attribs.current:
LE 3 SETTIMANE DI STONEMOON A "PANDORA/FALVEN"
Dopo il rituale di resurrezione di Vespero, nelle 3 settimane successive Stonemoon svolge le seugenti attività (per ordine di priorità):

- 1) finalizza le sue competenze con il linguaggio Silvano.
- 2) Abbandona l'armatura in camera e si mette un mantello per non essere riconosciuto ed aumentare al massimo le sue competenze di atletica e Stealth. 
A chiunque lo veda o gli rivolga parola durante le investigazioni si presenta con il suo psedonimo di "Ramingo".
Diffidente fin dall'inizio nei confronti del culto si mette a cercare informazioni in particolare sulla leader del culto "Esmeralda", su cui cerca informazioni sia su Pandora che su Falven. Qualche volta quando è sicuro di non essere visto la pedina da una distanza di sicurezza per carpirne i movimenti e le abitudini, raccoglie informazioni anche fra la malavita di Falven.
- 3) Quando non si concentra sul culto passa le sue ore nelle biblioteche di pandora e Falven in cerca dei segunti argomenti:
. Libri sulla Dea "Judit" per comprendere meglio il punto di vista dei suoi compagni.
. Libri Dea "Signora dei Corvi" per comprendere meglio il punto di vista dei suoi compagni.
. Libri sul Resuscitare i morti, nello specifico quello che richiede le ceneri          del morto come componente per motivi personali.
. Libri su storie e leggende o miti su posti magici o amuleti legati sempre alla resurrezione dei morti per motivi personali.
Se alcuni dei libri lo richiedono inzia a imparare le basi di un'altro linguaggio come Infernale,celestiale,ecc rimane una SCELTA DEL MASTER.
Prova a cercare anche biblioteche o libri "segreti" se li trova o meno è una SCELTA DEL MASTER.
Come azione di estremis (molto di estremis) se viene ritenuto necessario dal contesto Stonemoon può decidere di rubare un libro.

- 4) Dedicandosi allo studio e alle investigazioni passa pochissime ore di sonno che lo hanno reso più magro e sciupato del solito le conseguenze di questo rimangono SCELTA DEL MASTER.

- 5) L'umiliazione subita durante la festa legato come un salame deriso da tutti gli fa evitare di socializzare con i popolo di Pandora un pò per ripicca un pò per vergogna. L'umiliazione gli brucia per tutte e tre le settimane e anche se in un primo momento da la colpa a Zonturas e Thork si ritrova a rimproverare se stesso per essere un pessimo ranger. Quasi tutte le notti si allena in modo eccessivo per migliorare le proprie capacità, certe volte si risveglia nel luogo in cui si allena troppo stanco per ritornare alla propria camera. Sempre con la fastidiosa voce di Rialdon nelle orecchie che gli chiede che cosa vorrebbe diventare alla fine della loro avventura un Commerciante? un guerriero? un bounty hunter? domande che lo tengono sveglio la notte e che lo fanno allenare anche più duramente.

A SCELTA DEL MASTER SE AVANZA TEMPO (in ordine di priorità)

- 1 bis) Se vi è una gilda dei mercanti a Falven prova a conttatare la propria famiglia lasciata Ojun per assicurarsi che stiano bene.

- 2 bis) Se ci riesce in qualche modo prova ad aggiornarsi sulla situazione di Valimar, il fatto di aver lasciato la città durante la battaglia è un peso nello stomaco per la sua conoscenza, ma sa che nei confronti del gruppo non aveva scelta in merito.

- 3 bis) Nelle biblioteche prova a cercare libri con riferimenti ai simboli del suo amuleto (l'amuleto draconico trovato con lui dalla sua famiglia umana).

- 4 bis) Incontra altri Dragonborn su cui chiedere infromazioni sul suo amuleto, ma rimanendo sul vago e senza far intedere niente della sua storia (difficile per lui che non eccelle nel mentire e nei depistaggi). Sapendo di non essere bravo con le donne (anche perchè l'ho hanno visto tutti alla festa umiliato) evita dove possibile di chiedere infomazioni al gentil sesso.

- 5 bis) Aiuta Thork ad allenarsi nel combattimento bendato in ritorno Thork lo aiuta ad allenarsi ad apprendere le basi del guerriero (per eventuale multiclasse al porssimo livello)

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lw2Z6RLYYniVkR9Iazl_spelldescription
attribs.current: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of creatures: aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead. The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also can’t be charmed, frightened, or possessed by them. If the target is already charmed, frightened, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Lw2Z6RLYYniVkR9Iazl_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: Holy water or powdered silver and iron, which the spell consumes

when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lw2ccNJ73PEpNlmyVF5_description
attribs.current:
You have dedicated yourself to hunting down creatures
of the night and wielders of grim magic. A Monster
S layer seeks out vampires, dragons, evil fey, fiends, and
other magical threats. Trained in supernatural techniques to overcome such monste rs, s layers a re experts
at unearthing and defeating mighty, mystical foes.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lw3finQO31gzVflZrUc_description
attribs.current:
At 3rd level, you gain the ability to peer at a creature
a nd magically discern how best to hurt it. As an action,
choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you.
You immediately learn whether the creature has any
da mage immunities, resistances, or vulnerabilities and
what they a re. If the creature is hidden from divination
magic, you sense that it has no damage immunities, resistances, or vulnerabilities.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to
your Wisdom modifier (m inimum of once). You regain all
expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lw3ftY4lYcHUzTCKR4f_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 3rd level, you can focus your ire on one foe,
increasing the harm you inflict on it. As a bonus action,
you designate one creature you can see within 60 feet of
you as the target of this feature. The first time each turn
that you hit that target with a weapon attack, it takes an
extra 1d6 damage from the weapon.
This benefit lasts until you finish a short or long rest. It
ends early if you designate a diffe rent creature.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LxwTXcDROngavZ2W2QE_atk_desc
attribs.current: 1dX+STR+Proficient La X dipende dalla stazza del pg (Small=2,Medium=3,Big=4)

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LyGdgYRg6UNw1emyYCb_description
attribs.current:
Skilled at mimicry and dramatics, you gain the following benefits:

• Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

• You have an advantage on Charisma (Deception) and Charisma (Performance) checks when trying to pass yourself off as a different person.

• You can mimic the speech of another person or the sounds made by other creatures. You must have heard the person speaking, or heard the creature make the sound, for at least 1 minute. A successful Wisdom (Insight) check contested by your Charisma (Deception) check allows a listener to determine that the effect is faked.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Lyp9RehEmfOHi2E1nSR_atk_desc
attribs.current: +1 to hit, when you hit a creature with this bow you can force it to make a Constitution Saving Throw (DC 13). If it fails , you deal an extra 2d6 poison damage and the target is poisoned until the start of your next turn. If it succedes the save, the target takes half of that damage and it's not poisoned. Recharges with a short rest.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Lyp9RehEmfOHi2E1nSR_saveeffect
attribs.current: the target takes half of that damage and it's not poisoned

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LypHtptc8aTKjVnHKb9_description
attribs.current: Whenever you hit a creature with the "Spiked chain (two hand)" on your turn, you can use your bonus action to attempt to grapple the targeted creature. That weapon can only be used to attack the grappled creature for as long as it is grappled. When grappling from range, the target is pulled within 5 feet of you, unless creatures that are exactly two sizes larger than you doesn't automatically succeed on checks to escape the grapple, though your speed becomes 0 and they can move up to half their speed while grappled. If a grappled creature moves, it drags or carry you with them as if they are the ones grappling you.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Lxwt5EfBlWZltryLYPr_atk_desc
attribs.current: Whenever you hit a creature on your turn, you can use your bonus action to attempt to grapple the targeted creature. That weapon can only be used to attack the grappled creature for as long as it is grappled. When grappling from range, the target is pulled within 5 feet of you, unless creatures that are exactly two sizes larger than you doesn't automatically succeed on checks to escape the grapple, though your speed becomes 0 and they can move up to half their speed while grappled. If a grappled creature moves, it drags or carry you with them as if they are the ones grappling you.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-M5OclJTvtgnvWHG9OoI_spelldescription
attribs.current: The next time you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack before the spell ends, this spell creates a rain of thorns that sprouts from your ranged weapon or ammunition. In addition to the normal effect of the attack, the target of the attack and each creature within 5 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 1d10 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-M5OclJTvtgnvWHG9OoI_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st (to a maximum of 6d10).

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-M5OdqZUhmyirb8Umo3g_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Requires Attunement

While wearing this hat, you can use an action to cast the disguise self spell from it at will. The spell ends if the hat is removed.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-M2KPyxj1pvfRFZIK0J0_description
attribs.current:
You are a master of navigating the natural world, and you react with swift and decisive action when attacked. This grants you the following benefits:

• You ignore difficult terrain.
• You have advantage on initiative rolls.
• On your first turn during combat, you have advantage on attack rolls against creatures that have not yet acted.

In addition, you are skilled at navigating the wilderness. You gain the following benefits when traveling for an hour or more:

• Difficult terrain doesn’t slow your group’s travel.
• Your group can’t become lost except by magical means.
• Even when you are engaged in another activity while traveling (such as foraging, navigating, or tracking), you remain alert to danger.
• If you are traveling alone, you can move stealthily at a normal pace.
• When you forage, you find twice as much food as you normally would.
• While tracking other creatures, you also learn their exact number, their sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-M2KOrEOfMUkqjV9Nj5U_description
attribs.current:
You have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track your favored enemies, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them. 

• When you gain this feature, you also learn one language of your choice that is spoken by your favored enemies, if they speak one at all. 

• You choose one additional favored enemy, as well as an associated language, at 6th and 14th level. As you gain levels, your choices should reflect the types of monsters you have encountered on your adventures.

•  You gain a  +2 bonus to damage rolls with weapon attacks  against creatures of the chosen type.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Lu4H4ZZ6-wljjZ4lpfe_description
attribs.current:
As an action, you can communicate simple ideas to beasts and learn if their affected by magic, any short-term needs, and actions you can take to persuade it.

Spend 1 min. to sense if any of your favored enemies are within 5 miles of you. This reveals their numbers, general direction and distance.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-M6WGxfFFJawClyU-e5d_itemcontent
attribs.current: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-M6WGxfFFJawClyU-e5d_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 2d6, Damage Type: Slashing, Melee Attacks +1, Melee Damage +1

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-M6WGxg3l1LRgAGunV6X_atk_desc
attribs.current: Spadone a due mani +1, uno spadone Nero appartenuto a Re Yorek, emana un' aura oscura e sinistra. Nota con il nome di Gladionis e' famosa per essere l'arma che ha ucciso il principe di Davos.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-M6ppZFpS6Hi40BC3yeI_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Requires Attunement

While wearing these bracers, you have proficiency with the longbow and shortbow, and you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls on ranged attacks made with such weapons.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-M6ppzfA6F7lMUhZvPY8_itemcontent
attribs.current: You must be proficient with wind instruments to use these pipes. They have 3 charges. You can use an action to play them and expend 1 charge to create an eerie, spellbinding tune. Each creature within 30 feet of you that hears you play must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. If you wish, all creatures in the area that aren't hostile toward you automatically succeed on the saving throw. A creature that fails the saving throw can repeat it at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw is immune to the effect of these pipes for 24 hours. The pipes regain 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-M7Rnvnklh4dqKlKbZzU_itemname
attribs.current: Anello con il sigillo di Re Yorek

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-M7RpwuUpjyeqROZsmkO_itemcontent
attribs.current: As an action, you can spread a single bag of caltrops to cover a 5-foot-square area. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take 1 piercing damage. Until the creature regains at least 1 hit point, its walking speed is reduced by 10 feet. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-M7yLqnhSN8tld3BUV7h_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: Ashes from a burned leaf of mistletoe and a sprig of spruce

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-M7yLqnhSN8tld3BUV7h_spelldescription
attribs.current: A veil of shadows and silence radiates from you, masking you and your companions from detection. For the duration, each creature you choose within 30 feet of you (including you) has a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks and can’t be tracked except by magical means. A creature that receives this bonus leaves behind no tracks or other traces of its passage.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-M85Y2UDL9t9EJ2oNYpZ_description
attribs.current:
You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On Your Turn, you can use a Bonus Action to regain Hit Points equal to 1d10 + your Fighter level.

Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or Long Rest before you can use it again.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-M85ZORVwXYSquE4FmGE_description
attribs.current: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-M879pcEdtJZbLL5veIV_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-M879pcEdtJZbLL5veIV_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch a creature. The target’s speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-M87B4yDVqe2HnNdrsoW_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You move like the wind. Until the spell ends, your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

Once before the spell ends, you can give yourself advantage on one weapon attack roll on your turn. That attack deals an extra 1d8 force damage on a hit. Whether you hit or miss, your walking speed increases by 30 feet until the end of that turn.

attribs.current:
Requires Attunement

You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear this cloak.

attribs.current: Ring of Proof against Detection and Location

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-M8XQWec9Q0urXzcMB0K_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Requires attunement

While wearing this amulet, you are hidden from divination magic. You can't be targeted by such magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-M8XRuulZ-ghINjBbqQZ_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Requires Attunement by a Bard, Cleric, or Druid

This staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability modifier: cure wounds (1 charge per spell level, up to 4th), lesser restoration (2 charges). or mass cure wounds (5 charges).

The staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1. the staff vanishes in a flash of light, lost forever.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-M8XWZBDwWyM2bybmDk1_itemcontent
attribs.current: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-M8XWZBDwWyM2bybmDk1_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Heavy Armor, AC: 18, Ac +1

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-M8lKXNnngwbduHGFHJ5_itemcontent
attribs.current:
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon. A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-M8lKXNnngwbduHGFHJ5_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 30/120, Ranged Attacks +1, Ranged Damage +1

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-M8lfmjPStI7PBO5FKGu_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.
